intro: Dorstenia nipensis, commonly known as the "Mexican spider plant," is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. The plant is characterized by its slender, often twisted stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. It produces unique, spiral-shaped inflorescences that are both ornamental and attract pollinators. Dorstenia nipensis is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and ease of care in shaded environments.
